meanings.sent1: Exposure to teratogenic substances during pregnancy can harm the baby.
meanings.sent2: Doctors warn pregnant women to avoid teratogenic chemicals.
meanings.sent3: The teratogenic effects of the potion turned the frog into a prince with extra limbs.
meanings.sent4: The teratogenic power of the radiation transformed the landscape into a surreal painting.
meanings.sent5: The teratogenic nature of the virus left a trail of mutated creatures in its wake.

meanings.definition: A substance or agent that causes birth defects.
meanings.sent1: Researchers are studying the effects of teratogenic exposure on fetal development.
meanings.sent2: The teratogenic was identified as the main cause of the abnormalities in the newborns.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous teratogenic hid in the laboratory, causing chaos with its birth-defect spells.
meanings.sent4: The teratogenic in the water supply was like a silent saboteur of healthy pregnancies.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the teratogenic lurking in the shadows, waiting to disrupt the natural order.
